questions.question_text: Which two tasks about using central VPN management are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
AC refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 158

Selected Answer: AC
A and C
I think correct answer is A,C

choices.B: FortiManager installs VPN settings on both managed and external gateways.
choices.D: You must enable VPN zones for SD-WAN deployments.
choices.A: You can configure full mesh, star, and dial-up VPN topologies.
choices.C: You configure VPN communities to define common IPsec settings shared by all VPN gateways.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 63

choices.C: Dead members require manual administrator access to bring them back alive.
choices.B: The SD-WAN interface becomes disabled and port1 becomes the WAN interface.
choices.A: Port2 becomes alive after one successful probe is detected.
choices.D: Subnets 10.0.20.0/23 and 172.20.0.0/16 are reachable only through port1.
SD-WAN rules are evaluated in the same way as firewall policies: from top to bottom.
choices.C: The Vimeo SD-WAN rule steers Vimeo application traffic among all SD-WAN member interfaces.
choices.B: The implicit rule overrides all other rules because parameters widely cover sources and destinations.
choices.A: The first Vimeo session may not match the Vimeo SD-WAN rule because the session is used for the application learning phase.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
AD refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 33,94

Selected Answer: C
C refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 215

choices.A: Authentication should be set to Certificates.
choices.B: ADVPN should be enabled on unmanaged FortiGate devices only.
choices.C: The protected subnet of each gateway should be set all (0.0.0.0/0)
choices.D: The phase 1 proposal must match the phase 2 proposal.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
AC refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 71

Selected Answer: AC
correct is A and C

choices.D: All the existing sessions will continue to use port2, and new sessions will use port1.
choices.C: All the existing sessions with no SNAT will start using port1 as the outgoing interface instead of port2.
choices.A: All the existing sessions using SNAT will start using port1 as the outgoing interface instead of port2.
choices.B: All the existing sessions will be blocked from using port1 and port2.
